content: information about how to choose which type of installation based on prerequisites, available resources, and other factors, see 2.2, “Choosing a z/VM installation method” on page 36. This chapter includes the following topics:  5.1, “Obtaining z/VM through electronic download” on page 98  5.2, “Configuring an FTP server for z/VM installation” on page 108  5.3, “Installing z/VM from a DVD or an FTP server” on page 110  5.4, “Starting the z/VM installation” on page 111  5.5, “Installing VMSSI” on page 115  5.6, “Installing non-SSI z/VM” on page 124  5.7, “Initial TCP/IP configuration” on page 128  5.8, “Adding CTCAs to an SSI cluster” on page 130 5 Important: Prevent unnecessary problems and rework by fully completing all tasks in this volume in the order they are presented. Each chapter relies upon actions that are taken in the previous chapter. Also, each chapter and the sections within are sequenced to give you the quickest results. 98 Virtualization Cookbook: Vol 1: IBM z/VM
